member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1Hyperlink.LinkTarget
member.summary: Determines the target of the current hyperlink.

remarks.para: The hyperlink target is described by an instance of a class derived from , and can be of one of the following types:

item.description: An anchor defined within the current document.
A location within the current document.
An anchor defined within a previously saved C1D document.
An external document, program or URL. The ShellExecute API is used to invoke the link.
A page within the current document.
The hyperlink target is determined by a user event handler.

member.returns: The containing the target location.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1LinkTargetFile.FileName
member.summary: Specifies the file or object on which to execute the specified verb.
member.remarks: To specify a Shell namespace object, pass the fully qualified parse name. Note that not all verbs are supported on all objects. For example, not all document types support the "print" verb.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1LinkTargetFile.Command
member.summary: Gets the command (verb) specifying the action to perform when the link is clicked.

remarks.para: The set of available verbs depends on the particular file or folder. Generally, the actions available from an object's shortcut menu are available verbs.
For more information about verbs and their availability, see Object Verbs. See Extending Shortcut Menus for further discussion of shortcut menus.
The following verbs are commonly used.

list.item: edit Launches an editor and opens the document for editing. If FileName is not a document file, the function will fail.

item.description: Explores the folder specified by FileName.
Initiates a search starting from the specified directory.
Opens the file specified by the FileName parameter. The file can be an executable file, a document file, or a folder.
Prints the document file specified by FileName. If FileName is not a document file, the function will fail.

For systems prior to Microsoft? Windows? 2000, the default verb is used if it is valid and available in the registry. If not, the "open" verb is used. For Windows 2000 and later systems, the default verb is used if available. If not, the "open" verb is used. If neither verb is available, the system uses the first verb listed in the registry.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1LinkTargetFile.Parameters
member.summary: If the parameter specifies an executable file, this is a string specifying the parameters to be passed to the application. The format of this string is determined by the verb that is to be invoked. If specifies a document file, this should be an empty string.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.SelectBestMeasurementDevice
member.summary:
Selects a device to use for .
This method looks for a printer with a "square" resolution (i.e. with the same horizontal and vertical DPI) equal to or larger than 300 DPI. If such a printer is found, it is assigned to , and is set to . Otherwise, is set to .
The selected device's resolution is returned by .

Raises the event.
= changed to .
Executes the script.
... document's generation ...
Executes the script.
= changed to .
Raises the event.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.RenderDirectGraphicsEnd
member.summary: Renders the internally maintained object created with a previous call to onto the current page of the document.
member.remarks:
Internally, this method calls , passing the as the parameter, and resets the internal variable used to hold that value.
The coordinates at which is rendered are determined by the preceding call to .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.PageNumberingChange
member.summary: Gets or sets the object applied to the first page of the document.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.FontHandling
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating how font embedding and substitution are handled by the current .
For details on the available options see members of the enumeration.
Note that if this property is set to a value other than or
(i.e. fonts are not embedded automatically), you may manually add certain fonts that you want embedded, to the document's collection.
The default value of this property is .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.EmbeddedFonts
member.summary:
Gets the collection of fonts embedded in the current document.
If property on the document has been set to or , this collection is populated automatically when the document generates.
Otherwise, this collection is not populated automatically. But you can add fonts to this collection in code, so that just the added fonts will be embedded in the document. Note that in that case you must also explicitly specify the glyphs to include by calling the method or any of its overloads.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.AutoEmbedFonts
member.summary:
This property is obsolete. Gets or sets a value indicating whether the collection will be automatically filled with fonts used in the document during document generation.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.MaxPages
member.summary:
Gets or sets the value limiting the maximum number of pages in the generated document.
The default value is -1, indicating that the number of pages in the document is unlimited.
This property is only taken into account when the document is created using the method.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.CreationMode
member.summary: Gets the document creation mode.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.CreationDpi
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution (DPI) used during document creation. Note that if is , this is also the resolution of ResolvedUnit pixels.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.CreationGraphics
member.summary: Gets or sets the object used when the document is created. That Graphics is used to calculate text sizes, measure RTF text, and so on.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.BusyState
member.summary: Gets the current busy state of the current document.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.EmfType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of metafiles created by the current document. The default is .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.DocumentInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets the object containing the information about the current document (such as author, company, and so on).

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.ResolvedUnit
member.summary:
Gets or sets the value that will be used to specify the resolved sizes of objects within the current document (e.g. the sizes of objects representing the render objects in the document).
This property cannot be changed when the document is generating (i.e. while returns true).

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.PageLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the default page layout for the current document. This property is a shortcut for . (A page layout includes page settings, page headers and footers, and column definitions.)

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.PageLayouts
member.summary: Gets the collection of page layouts used in the current document. In addition to the default layout which is always present, special layouts may be defined for first, last, even and odd pages of the document. The effective layout for each page is then produced by merging all applicable layouts.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.Stacking
member.summary:
Gets or sets the top-level stacking rule for the document body.
The default value is .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.DefaultUnit
member.summary:
Gets or sets the default unit of measurement for the current document. This unit is used when sizes or coordinates of objects within the document are set without specifying the unit of measurement explicitly.
The default value is .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.Body
member.summary: Gets the object representing the body of the current document.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.Tags
member.summary: Gets the representing the collection of user-defined objects in the current document.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.TagOpenParen
member.summary:
Gets or sets the string used as the opening parentheses when including references to objects in the current document's texts (e.g. in or ). To include a TagOpenParen string itself in a text, prepend it with the string.
The default value is "[".

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.TagCloseParen
member.summary:
Gets or sets the string used as the closing parentheses when including references to objects in the current document's texts (e.g. in or ). To include a TagCloseParen string itself in a text, prepend it with the string.
The default value is "]".

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.TagEscapeString
member.summary:
Gets or sets the string that can be used to escape and . To include a TagEscapeString string itself in a text, duplicate it.
The default value is "\".

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.ThrowExceptionOnError
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether an exception should be raised if an error occurs while the current document generates. If this property is false, the method will return false if errors occurred while generating, otherwise an exception will be thrown on the first error.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.AllowNonReflowableDocs
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether methods can be called on the current document that would result in the document becoming non-reflowable (such as ). If this property is false, calling such methods throws an exception. If this property is true, calling such methods sets the flag to false on the current document.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.ClipPage
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether to clip the content of the current document to page margins.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.DisableUserReflow
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the end user should be prevented from reflowing the document with different page settings. This property is only a hint to the document viewer.
The default value is false (i.e. reflow is allowed).

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.UseGdiPlusTextRendering
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether text in the current document should be rendered using the GDI+ text API.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.DoEvents
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current should handle Windows messages while generating.
The default value is false.

remarks.para: Setting this property to true allows users to resize forms, click buttons, etc. while documents are being generated. This makes applications more responsive, and is necessary if you want to provide a "Cancel" button to stop the document generation (otherwise the user wouldn't be able to click the button until the generation is complete).
Setting this property to false will cause documents to generate slightly faster.

example.para: The code below implements "Generate" and "Cancel" buttons attached to a .

The "Generate" button checks whether the document is busy before starting to generate it. This is necessary because the user could click the "Generate" button several times in a row, before the document got a chance to finish generating. (Calling the method while the component is busy throws an exception.)
The "Cancel" button checks whether the document is currently generating, and sets the property to true if it is.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.IsPageCountFinal
member.summary:
Gets a value indicating whether all pages have been added to the document being generated.
For example, if the document has a page footer or header that includes the total page count (of the kind "Page X of Y"), this property gets false while new pages are being added, but true when adding new pages is over and the total page count is being updated on the rendered pages.
If the document is currently not generating (see ), gets true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.GeneratingComplete
member.summary: If the current document is generating (see ), gets the approximate completion ratio, from 0 (0% complete) to 1 (100% complete). If the document is currently not generating, gets 1.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.CurrentPageLayout
member.summary:
Gets the effective layout for the current page. That layout is automatically built on the fly by merging all applicable layouts defined for the current document in . You may change the properties on CurrentPageLayout programmatically. The changes will be effective immediately if they are made in the event handler, otherwise they will take effect for the next added page.
Note that this property is only available during document generation, at other times null is returned.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.DocumentStartingScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the script that is executed when the current document starts generating.

remarks.para: also fires the event at this time.

The difference between events and scripts is that event handlers belong to the application code, while scripts belong to the document. Thus it is recommended that event handlers be used to perform tasks that implement the overall application logic but do not depend on the specific document being processed.

On the other hand, scripts should be used to perform tasks directly related to the document itself. Scripts attached to a document are executed regardless of the current application (e.g. when the document is regenerated after being loaded from file by a different program). (For example, a document might contain a script that changes the value of a field in that document when an error occurs.)

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.DocumentEndedScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the script that is executed when the current document has finished generating.

remarks.para: also fires the event at this time.

The difference between events and scripts is that event handlers belong to the application code, while scripts belong to the document. Thus it is recommended that event handlers be used to perform tasks that implement the overall application logic but do not depend on the specific document being processed.

On the other hand, scripts should be used to perform tasks directly related to the document itself. Scripts attached to a document are executed regardless of the current application (e.g. when the document is regenerated after being loaded from file by a different program). (For example, a document might contain a script that changes the value of a field in that document when an error occurs.)

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.PageConfigureScript
member.summary:
Gets or sets the script that is executed when a new page is added to the document. This script executes after the page has been added to the collection but before it is resolved (i.e. when the content of the page has not been laid out yet).
This script should be used only to change the page layout. Do not use this script to change the page content, as it may cause errors.

remarks.para: also fires the event at this time.

The difference between events and scripts is that event handlers belong to the application code, while scripts belong to the document. Thus it is recommended that event handlers be used to perform tasks that implement the overall application logic but do not depend on the specific document being processed.

On the other hand, scripts should be used to perform tasks directly related to the document itself. Scripts attached to a document are executed regardless of the current application (e.g. when the document is regenerated after being loaded from file by a different program). (For example, a document might contain a script that changes the value of a field in that document when an error occurs.)

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintDocument.ErrorScript
member.summary: Gets or sets the script that is executed when an error occurs in a script attached to the current document.

remarks.para: The event is also fired at the same time as this script is executed.

The difference between events and scripts is that event handlers belong to the application code, while scripts belong to the document. Thus it is recommended that event handlers be used to perform tasks that implement the overall application logic but do not depend on the specific document being processed.

On the other hand, scripts should be used to perform tasks directly related to the document itself. Scripts attached to a document are executed regardless of the current application (e.g. when the document is regenerated after being loaded from file by a different program). (For example, a document might contain a script that changes the value of a field in that document when an error occurs.)

member.summary: Adds unique glyphs or glyph ranges from the specified string to the current . The ranges recognized by this method are represented by the enumeration.
member.param: The string to add the glyphs from.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.StackingRulesEnum
member.summary: Defines the stacking rules: block or inline flow, top to bottom or left to right for block flow.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.StackingRulesEnum.BlockTopToBottom
member.summary: Objects are placed one beneath another within the container. When the bottom edge of the current page is reached, a new page is added. This is the default.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.StackingRulesEnum.BlockLeftToRight
member.summary: Objects are placed one next to another, from left to right. When the right edge of the current page is reached, a new horizontal page is added (a horizontal page logically extends the preceding page to the right; C1PreviewPane respects this location by default, showing such pages in a row).

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.StackingRulesEnum.InlineLeftToRight
member.summary: Objects are placed inline, one next to another, from left to right. When the right edge of the current page is reached, the sequence wraps to the next line. A new page is added when the bottom of the current page is reached.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.GraphicsHolder
member.summary: Holds a Graphics object together with (printer) device or bitmap that was used to create it, if any. The point is to dispose the device or bitmap together with the graphics when it is no longer needed (i.e. to avoid resource leaks).

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.GraphicsHolder.Empty
member.summary: An empty graphics holder instance.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.GraphicsHolder.FromDC(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates a graphics holder from a device context. When the holder is disposed, both graphics and the device context are released (DeleteDC is called on the device context).
member.param: The device context from which graphics is created.
member.returns: The new instance of the graphics holder.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.GraphicsHolder.FromGraphics(System.Drawing.Graphics)
member.summary: Creates a graphics holder from a graphics instance. When the holder is disposed, the graphics is left alone (i.e. NOT disposed).
member.param: The graphics to store in the new holder.
member.returns: The new instance of the graphics holder.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.GraphicsHolder.FromScreen
member.summary: Creates a graphics holder from screen. If that fails (e.g. on Azure), the graphics is created from a bitmap. When the holder is disposed, both graphics and the bitmap are released.
member.returns: The new instance of the graphics holder.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.GraphicsHolder.FromBitmap
member.summary: Creates a graphics holder from a bitmap. The graphics and the bitmap are released when the holder is disposed. This should never fail.
member.returns: The new instance of the graphics holder.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.GraphicsHolder.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the current graphics holder.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.GraphicsHolder.Graphics
member.summary: Gets the graphics object held by the current instance.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.GraphicsHolder.DpiX
member.summary: Gets the horizontal resolution of graphics held by the current instance.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.GraphicsHolder.DpiY
member.summary: Gets the vertical resolution of graphics held by the current instance.

member.summary: Determines the target of the current hyperlink.

item.description: An anchor defined within the current document.
A location within the current document.
An anchor defined within a previously saved C1D document.
An external document, program or URL. The ShellExecute API is used to invoke the link.
A page within the current document.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderObject.X
member.summary:
Gets or sets the X coordinate of the current object.
May be specified as auto (), an absolute value (using ), an absolute value with unit of measurement (e.g. "12mm"), or an expression referencing this and other objects (e.g. "prev.right+2mm").

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderObject.Y
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Y coordinate of the current object.
May be specified as auto (), an absolute value (using ), an absolute value with unit of measurement (e.g. "12mm"), or an expression referencing this and other objects (e.g. "prev.height/2-self.height/2").

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderObject.Width
member.summary:
Gets or sets the width of the current object.
May be specified as auto (), a percentage of the parent's width (e.g. "50%"), an absolute value (using ), an absolute value with unit of measurement (e.g. "12mm"), or an expression referencing this and other objects (e.g. "Max(prev.width,6cm)").

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderObject.Height
member.summary:
Gets or sets the height of the current object.
May be specified as auto (), a percentage of the parent's height (e.g. "50%"), an absolute value (using ), an absolute value with unit of measurement (e.g. "12mm"), or an expression referencing this and other objects (e.g. "150%prev.height+1in").

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderObject.BreakAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of break (none, line, column, or page) to insert after the current object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderObject.LayoutChangeBefore
member.summary: Gets or sets the object defining the change of page layout that will occur before the current object.
member.remarks:
is an abstract class. Instances of the following non-abstract classes derived from it can be assigned to this property:
Does not insert a break. Provides the ability to change page layout for the next page without interrupting the current flow.
Inserts a line break in the inline flow. Does not break the block flow.
Starts a new column in a multi-column layout, or a new page otherwise.
Starts a new page.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderObject.LayoutChangeAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets the object defining the change of page layout that will occur after the current object.
member.remarks:
is an abstract class. Instances of the following non-abstract classes derived from it can be assigned to this property:
Does not insert a break. Provides the ability to change page layout for the next page without interrupting the current flow.
Inserts a line break in the inline flow. Does not break the block flow.
Starts a new column in a multi-column layout, or a new page otherwise.
Starts a new page.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex
member.summary: Represents an alphabetical, optionally multi-level, word index in a .
member.remarks:
To create an index, follow these steps:
Create an instance of the class, store it in a local variable.
For each index entry, create an instance of the class.
For each occurrence of each index entry in the document, create an instance of the class, and set the on it to point to the location of that occurrence in the document.
After all occurrences have been added to their entries, and all entries have been added to the , add the object created in the first step, to the document. When the document generates, that object will create the alphabetically sorted word index with clickable page numbers.
Please note that a must be added after all occurrences of all entries contained in it. If an occurrence appears after the containing it, it is ignored when the index is built.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.EntrySplitBehavior
member.summary:
Determines how a single entry can split vertically. This property applies to entries at all levels.
The default is .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.RunIn
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether that sub-entries should appear inline with the main heading rather than on separate indented lines.
The default is false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.PageNumbersAtRight
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether page numbers in the generated index should be right-aligned.
The default is false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.FillChar
member.summary:
Gets or sets a character used to fill the empty space between an index entry's and the page number or numbers referencing the occurrences of that entry. This property is only used if on the current has been set to true.
The default is a dot ('.').

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.EntryIndent
member.summary:
Gets or sets the indent of sub-entries relative to the main index entry.
The default is 1/4 of an inch.
member.remarks: While this property has the type, only absolute values (such as "10mm", "0.5in" and so on - see ) can be assigned to it.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.EntryHangingIndent
member.summary:
Gets or sets the hanging indent of the first line of an entry's paragraph relative to the following lines (used if the list of occurrences and cross-references for the entry is too long to fit on a single line).
The default is 1/8 of an inch.
member.remarks: While this property has the type, only absolute values (such as "10mm", "0.5in" and so on - see ) can be assigned to it.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.Entries
member.summary: Gets the collection of entries (elements of type ) at the top level of the current index.
member.remarks: This method always returns a non-null, creating it if it did not exist. To test whether the current index already contains entries without creating the collection, use the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.HasEntries
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the collection has been created and contains one or more elements.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.SeeAlsoStyle
member.summary:
Gets the of the "See (...)" text used to list cross-references between entries of the current .
Note that this style is only applied to the static text of the format string, but not to the entries' list output by that format.
member.remarks: When the index generates, new objects are created to represent the "See also" cross-references. As all content objects in a , each such object has an inline style that is used to actually render that object. That style is created on the fly, and the SeeAlsoStyle is assigned to and properties of that .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.HeadingStyle
member.summary: Gets the used for letter headings generated by the current index. (A heading is a letter preceding the group of entries beginning with that letter.)
member.remarks: When the index generates, new objects are created to represent the headings. As all content objects in a , each such object has an inline style that is used to actually render that object. That style is created on the fly, and the HeadingStyle is assigned to and properties of that .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.EntryStyles
member.summary: Gets the collection containing the styles used to render entries of the current at different levels.
member.remarks: When the index generates, new objects are created to represent the index entries. As all content objects in a , each such object has an inline style that is used to actually render that object. That style is created on the fly, and the element of the EntryStyles collection at the corresponding position (0 for top-level entries, 1 for sub-entries, and so on) is assigned to and properties of that .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.EntryStyle
member.summary: Gets the style of index entries at the top level. This is a shortcut to the first (with index 0) element of the collection.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.LetterSplitBehavior
member.summary: Gets or sets a that determines how a letter group (entries starting with the same letter) can split vertically. The default is . Note that headings (represented by their letters by default) are always printed together with their first entry

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.LetterFormat
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string used to format the letter group headings.
The default is "{0}".

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.TermDelimiter
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string used to delimit an index entry and the list of that entry's occurrences (page numbers) in the generated index.
The default is ", " (comma followed by space).

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.OccurrenceDelimiter
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string used to delimit the occurrences (page numbers) of an index entry in the generated index.
The default is ", " (comma followed by space).

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.PageRangeFormat
member.summary:
Gets or sets a format string used to format the page ranges of occurrences of index entries in the generated index.
The default is "{0}-{1}".
member.remarks: When an index entry occurs on consecutive pages in a document (e.g. on pages 3, 4 and 5), those occurrences are collapsed into a range ("3-5" in that case). PageRangeFormat is used to format those ranges.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderIndex.SeeAlsoFormat
member.summary:
Gets or sets a format string used to format the "See also" cross-references in the generated index.
The default is "(see {0})".

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum
member.summary: Specifies an action that is to be performed when the TAB key is pressed on a page containing -derived objects, while the containing is shown by a supporting viewer (e.g. by C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PrintPreviewControl).

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossPage
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control on the current page, but does not leave the preview nor goes to another page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossDoc
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control in the document (including across pages). Focus does not leave the preview control.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossPageCycle
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control on the current page. When the last control is reached focus goes to the first control on the same page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossDocCycle
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control in the document. When the last control is reached focus goes to the first control in the document.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossPageOut
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control on the current page. When the last control on the page is reached focus leaves the preview control, and goes to the next control on the form.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionTabEnum.MoveAccrossDocOut
member.summary: Focus moves to the next control in the document. When the last control in the document is reached focus leaves the preview control, and goes to the next control on the form.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionEnterEnum
member.summary: Specifies an action that is to be performed when the ENTER key is pressed on a page containing -derived objects, while the containing is shown by a supporting viewer (e.g. by C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PrintPreviewControl).

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionEnterEnum.None
member.summary: No action is taken.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionEnterEnum.LikeTab
member.summary: The same action as that of the TAB key is taken.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.FormsKeyActionEnterEnum.InvokeAcceptButton
member.summary: The current form's Accept button is invoked.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.ActionHandlerBase
member.summary: The abstract base class for types representing various document-related actions that can be performed in response to a user action on a control produced by a object.

remarks.para: When a containing one or more -derived objects is shown by a supporting viewer control such as C1PrintPreviewControl, each RenderInputBase object produces a corresponding control on the document page. E.g. a produces a textbox control where the user can enter text, a produces a pushbutton, and so on.

The functionality of those input controls in the document can be expanded via "action handlers", which are similar to C# or VB event handlers that can be assigned to events on many .NET components. The list of supported events is specified by the enumeration, and includes mouse click, mouse enter and leave, keyboard focus enter and leave, and mouse up and down events.
To create and attach a handler to a user action on a -derived object, follow these general steps:

list.item: Create an instance of a -derived class of the concrete type that matches the action that needs to be performed, such as a hyperlink jump or a file operation. (Those classes include , , , , , , , and .)
Some of those classes expose action-specific properties (such as ). Adjust the values of those properties as needed.
Create an instance of the class, set its property to the desired user action (such as click or focus enter), and set its property to the instance created in the preceding steps.
Add the to the collection of the object.

remarks.para: Note that several objects can be associated with a single render input control.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.BordersSplitMode
member.summary: Specifies how borders are drawn when the object is split between pages.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.BordersSplitMode.None
member.summary: Borders are not drawn where the object is split.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.BordersSplitMode.Square
member.summary: Square borders are drawn where the object is split.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.BordersSplitMode.Round
member.summary: Borders are drawn where the object is split. If the border is round (see , ), round borders are drawn where the object is split.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum
member.summary: Defines the splitting behavior of a render object.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum.Never
member.summary: The object should not be split between pages (i.e. should always be kept together on a single page).

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum.SplitIfNeeded
member.summary: The object can be split if it does not fit onto the current page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum.SplitIfLarge
member.summary: The object can be split only if it is too large to fit on an empty page. In that case, the object is split immediately. Otherwise, a new page is started and the object is placed on it without splitting.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitBehaviorEnum.SplitNewPage
member.summary: If the object does not fit on the current page (column), a new page (column) is started; if the object does not fit on that page (column), it is split as needed after that.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.BreakEnum
member.summary: Defines the various breaks which can be forced before or after render object.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.BreakEnum.None
member.summary: No break.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.BreakEnum.Page
member.summary: New page should be started.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.BreakEnum.Column
member.summary: New column should be started.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.BreakEnum.Line
member.summary: New line on inline flow should be started.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.VisibilityEnum
member.summary: Specifies the visibility of an object.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.VisibilityEnum.Visible
member.summary: Object is visible.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.VisibilityEnum.Hidden
member.summary: Object is not visible, but takes up space and affects the layout of other objects as if it were visible.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.VisibilityEnum.Collapse
member.summary: Object is not visible, its size is zero and it does not affect the layout of other objects.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVector.Ordinal
member.summary: Gets the 0-based index of the current vector in the containing (i.e. the row index for rows, the column index for columns).
member.remarks: In tables, elements (cells, rows and columns) are physically created only if they contain data, or if their style differs from default. Hence the physical position of a object (i.e. a row or a column) in the containing (accessible via the vector's property) is not the same as the logical index of that row or column in the table. The Ordinal property allows to retrieve that logical position.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorCollection.Count
member.summary: Gets or sets the logical count of vectors (rows or columns) in the current collection. Setting this property to -1 (which is the default) ensures that Count is calculated automatically.
member.remarks: tables are logically infinite. Simply accessing an element at any position expands the table to include that position. Hence by default the Count property returns the maximum row or column number that has been accessed so far. Assigning a non-negative value to this property allows to increase or decrease the number of rows or columns (if the number of vectors is decreased, elements with greater indices are cleared).

remarks.para: Setting this property checks the current value of the property. If it is a , the is assigned to that object's .

Otherwise, a new initialized with is created and assigned to . Note that properties from the old are copied to the newly created using the method. In particular, this copies the style from the old object to the new one.
Getting this property returns of assigned to the on the current cell, or an empty string if the current value of is not a .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableCell.Style

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableCell.CellStyle
member.summary: Gets the that is used to render the content of the current cell.
member.remarks:
This style is not applied to the current cell itself, rather it is applied to the cell's content (), affecting both ambient and non-ambient style attributes of that object.
For an example, see remarks in .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableCell.Bounds
member.summary:
Gets a describing the geometry of the current cell in the table.
The location of the returned rectangle defines the location (column and row) of the current cell, while its size defines the number of columns and rows spanned by the current cell.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum
member.summary: Flags specifying how a table header is repeated in a . This is the type of .

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum.None
member.summary: The header is printed once at the top of the table.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum.Page
member.summary: The header is repeated at the top of each page. If there are multiple columns per page, the header is repeated only at the top of the first column on the page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum.Column
member.summary: The header is repeated only if there are multiple columns per page, at the top of each column except the first on the page. If there is only one column, the header is not printed at all.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableHeaderEnum.All
member.summary: The header is repeated at the top of all pages. If there are multiple columns per page, the header is repeated at the top of each column.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum
member.summary: Flags specifying how a table footer is repeated in a . This is the type of .

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum.None
member.summary: The footer is printed once at the end of the table.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum.Page
member.summary: The footer is repeated at the bottom of each page. If there are multiple columns per page, the footer is repeated only at the bottom of the last column on the page.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum.Column
member.summary: The footer is repeated only if there are multiple columns per page, at the bottom of each column except the last on the page. If there is only one column, the footer is not printed at all.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.TableFooterEnum.All
member.summary: The footer is repeated at the bottom of all pages. If there are multiple columns per page, the footer is repeated at the bottom of each column.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorGroup.SplitBehavior
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value determining how the current group is treated when it is too high (if it is a group of rows) or too wide (if it is a group of columns) to fit in the vertical or horizontal space available on the current page.
The default value is .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorGroup.CanSplit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current group can split between pages. The default is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorGroup.PageHeader
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current group should be repeated as a table header on each page where the containing table is printed.
Only one row and column group in a table can has this property set to true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorGroup.PageFooter
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current group should be repeated as a table footer on each page where the containing table is printed.
Only one row and column group in a table can has this property set to true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorGroup.ColumnHeader
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current group should be repeated as a table header on each column where the containing table is printed.
Only one row and column group in a table can has this property set to true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorGroup.ColumnFooter
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current group should be repeated as a table footer on each column where the containing table is printed.
Only one row and column group in a table can has this property set to true.

member.summary: Gets or sets flags indicating whether the current group should be treated as a table header repeated on each page and/or column.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorGroup.Footer

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.TableVectorGroup.MinVectorsAfter

That area does not include any padding or borders, so for example if a has a 1 inch left padding, and the first is set to 1 inch, any text after the first tab char will be positioned 2 inches to the right of the 's X coordinate.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.RenderVerticalText
member.summary:
Represents a run of vertical text in a .
Designed primarily for rendering of Asian (e.g. Japanese) text in the traditional manner, vertically from right to left.
Text is drawn using a single style (see for multi-style text).

remarks.para: The default height and width of is auto. In particular, that means that text without line breaks will by default stretch downwards indefinitely. To make text wrap at the bottom, the height of the object must be explicitly set.
Note that while the main use of this class is to output text in Asian languages, you can also print English text in this manner. To do so, add hex code 0xFEE0 to each English letter.

member.remarks:
If both this and are non-zero, all borders are drawn using the same () border thickness.
If this value is less than the border thickness, border thickness is used as the radius.

member.summary: Represents the shadow cast by a .

member.summary: Represents the shadow cast by a . This interface is implemented by structure.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.IShadow.Transparency
member.summary: Gets or sets the transparency of the shadow, in percent. A value of 0 defines a solid (non-transparent) shadow, a value of 100 (which is the default) defines a fully transparent (invisible) shadow.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.IShadow.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the shadow relative to the size of the object, in percent. A value of 100 (which is the default) indicates that the shadow has the same size as the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.IShadow.Distance
member.summary:
Gets or sets the distance that the shadow's center is offset from the the object's center. Note that only absolute values (such as "0.5in" or "4mm") can be assigned to this property.
The default is 2mm.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.IShadow.Angle
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle, in degrees, of the shadow. The angle is measured relative to the three o'clock position clockwise. The default is 45.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.IShadow.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the shadow. The default is Black.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.Style
member.summary: Represents the style of an object.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.Style.Clear
member.summary: Clears the current style, resets all properties so that they inherit from the parent style.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.Style.AssignNonInheritedFrom(C1.C1Preview.Style)
member.summary: Copies to the current style all properties of another object that have been explicitly set on that other style, plus the values of the and properties.
member.param: The source object to copy properties from.
member.remarks: Effectively, this method makes the current a complete copy of the style.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.HasExprs
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current style has calculated properties.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.Owner
member.summary: Gets the owner of the current style.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.Parent
member.summary:
Gets or sets the that is the parent of the current style.
If non-null, that style provides the values for non-ambient properties of the current style that have not been explicitly set.
If null, such properties have default values.
This property is null by default.
member.remarks: Initially a object does not have any explicitly set properties. This means that the effective values of all ambient properties (such as font) are inherited from the style of the containing object, while the effective values of all non-ambient properties (such as borders) are inherited from the style specified by this property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.Parents
member.summary: Sets both parents ( and ) to the same value.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.Children
member.summary: Gets the collection of child styles (i.e. objects that have their set to the current style).
member.remarks: This method always returns a non-null collection of child styles, initializing it if it did not exist. To test whether a style already has child styles without creating the collection, use the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.HasChildren
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current style's collection has been initialized and contains one or more elements.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.AmbientParent
member.summary:
Gets or sets the that is the ambient parent of the current style.
If non-null, that style provides the values for ambient properties of the current style that have not been explicitly set.
If null, such properties are inherited from the style of the containing object.
This property is null by default.
member.remarks:
Initially a object does not have any explicitly set properties. This means that the effective values of all ambient properties (such as font) are inherited from the style of the containing object, unless this property has been set to a non-null value, in which case they are inherited from that style.
Note that even if an AmbientParent has been specified, only ambient properties that have been explicitly set on that style or any of its own ambient parents (styles or containing objects) propagate to the current style. See example below for details.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the background image. The image is aligned using .
member.remarks:
This property is non-ambient (inherited from the of the current style if not explicitly set).
The default is no image.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.BackgroundImageName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the background image in on the current document.
member.remarks:
This property is non-ambient (inherited from the of the current style if not explicitly set).
The default is emtpy string.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.Brush
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush used to fill the background. If both this and properties are specified for a style, the BackColor takes precedence.
member.remarks:
This property is non-ambient (inherited from the of the current style if not explicitly set).
The default is no brush.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.TextColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the text (foreground) color.
member.remarks:
This property is ambient (inherited from the style of the object containing the current style's owner if not explicitly set).
The default is black color.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.TextAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the text rotation angle, in degrees counterclockwise from the X axis.
member.remarks:
This property is non-ambient (inherited from the of the current style if not explicitly set).
The default is 0.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.TextAlignHorz
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal text alignment.
member.remarks:
This property is ambient (inherited from the style of the object containing the current style's owner if not explicitly set).
The default is left alignment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.TextAlignVert
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical text alignment.
member.remarks:
This property is ambient (inherited from the style of the object containing the current style's owner if not explicitly set).
The default is top alignment.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.LineSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the line spacing of a text in percent.
member.remarks:
This property is ambient (inherited from the style of the object containing the current style's owner if not explicitly set).
The default is 100% (normal line spacing).

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.WordWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether text automatically wraps to the next line when there is not enough space left on the current line.
member.remarks:
This property is ambient (inherited from the style of the object containing the current style's owner if not explicitly set).
The default is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.TextPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether text is rendered normally, or as superscript or subscript.
member.remarks:
This property is non-ambient (inherited from the of the current style if not explicitly set).
The default is normal text.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.HyperlinkAttrs
member.summary: Gets or sets a for "normal" (neither visited nor highlighted) hyperlinks.
member.remarks:
This property is ambient (inherited from the style of the object containing the current style's owner if not explicitly set).
The default is to highlight hyperlinks with blue text color.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.VisitedHyperlinkAttrs
member.summary: Gets or sets a for visited hyperlinks.
member.remarks:
This property is ambient (inherited from the style of the object containing the current style's owner if not explicitly set).
The default is to highlight visited hyperlinks with magenta text color.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.HoverHyperlinkAttrs
member.summary: Gets or sets a for highlighted hyperlinks.
member.remarks:
This property is ambient (inherited from the style of the object containing the current style's owner if not explicitly set).
The default is to underline text on a hyperlinks under mouse.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.ActiveHyperlinkAttrs
member.summary: Gets or sets a for active hyperlinks.
member.remarks:
This property is ambient (inherited from the style of the object containing the current style's owner if not explicitly set).
The default is to not highlight active hyperlinks.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.MeasureTrailingSpaces
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether spaces at ends of text lines are taken into account when measuring the text.
member.remarks:
This property is ambient (inherited from the style of the object containing the current style's owner if not explicitly set).
The default is false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding (white space added between the style owner's content and borders).
member.remarks:
Padding is within (if any), while is added outside of borders.
This property is non-ambient (inherited from the of the current style if not explicitly set).
The default is no padding.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.Style.Spacing

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.LengthRef.Elements
member.summary: Gets the array of objects composing the path to the target object of the current reference length. If the current reference

remarks.para: If the current object uses a simple (not nested) reference such as "parent.width", this array contains just one element, corresponding to the parent object.

If the current object uses a nested reference such as "parent.MyChildName.width", this array contains a element for each object in the hierarchy (one for parent, and one for MyChildName in this example).

member.summary: No barcode.

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.BarCodeEnum.Code39
member.summary: Alpha-numeric, (Code 3 of 9).

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.BarCodeEnum.Code93
member.summary: Alpha-numeric.

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.BarCodeEnum.Code128
member.summary: Alpha-numeric, denser than Code39 and required at least 6 characters.

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.BarCodeEnum.CodeI2of5
member.summary: Numeric only.

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.BarCodeEnum.Codabar
member.summary: Numeric only, slightly denser than Code39.

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.BarCodeEnum.PostNet
member.summary: Numeric only, US Postal Service.

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.BarCodeEnum.Ean13
member.summary: EAN-13 barcode. EAN-13 encodes 12-digit article codes (plus one check digit created by the control).

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.BarCodeEnum.Ean8
member.summary: EAN-8 barcode. EAN-8 encodes 7-digit article codes (plus one check digit created by the control).

member.name: F:C1.C1Report.BarCodeEnum.UpcA
member.summary: UPC-A barcode. UPC-A encodes 11-digit article codes (plus one check digit created by the control).

summary.para: UPC-E is a variation of UPC-A which allows for a more compact barcode by eliminating "extra" zeros. Since the resulting UPC-E barcode is about half the size as an UPC-A barcode, it is generally used on products with very small packaging.
When using the UpcE encoding, set the Text property to an 11-digit string as if you were using the UpcA encoding.

Note that not all UpcA codes can be encoded in UpcE. If the manufacturer code ends with "000", "100", or "200", the product number must be <= 900. If the manufacturer code ends with "00" but not with "100", "200", or "300", then the product number must be <= 90. If the manufacturer code ends with "0" but not with "00", then the product number must be <= 9. If the manufacturer code does not end with "0", then the product number must be between 5 and 9.

member.name: T:C1.C1Report.DataSource
member.summary: Provides data for reports.

remarks.para: Most reports specify their data sources by setting the and properties. The DataSource object uses these values to connect to a database and retrieve the report data.

Alternatively, you can assign data objects directly to the property. This approach is more efficient in scenarios where the data has already been loaded by the application for other purposes, and can be used in the report directly instead of loading a copy.

member.summary: Processes the PARAMETERS clause in the string and returns the result.

remarks.para: This property is related to the property. The property sets or returns a string that specifies the source dataset for the report, and it may contain a PARAMETERS clause that causes to prompt the user for information.
If you wanted to use the value of the property to open a dataset directly from your program, you would have to parse the PARAMETERS clause yourself.

member.param: If set to true, user will be prompted for the parameters before the method returns. If set to false, the default values will be used.
member.returns: The string (SQL statement or table name) that can be used to open a recordset.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.DataSource.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string used to open a database.

remarks.para: The is used by the class to load the report data.
The class uses an object to retrieve the data, so the syntax for the is the one used OleDb connection strings. For details on the syntax, see the documentation for the class.
The specifies the database that contains the report data. The property specifies which table, stored procedure, or Sql command to use for retrieving the data.
If you want to use a different type of connection (e.g. a , or if your application already has the data available in a object, you can assign the data directly to the property.

remarks.para: The specifies the database that contains the report data. The property specifies which table, stored procedure, or Sql command to use for retrieving the data.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.DataSource.Filter
member.summary: Gets or sets the expression used to filter which data rows are included in the report.

remarks.para: Use the Filter property to restrict the records that you want to include in a report without modifying the property.

Using a filter is similar to specifying a WHERE clause in the SQL statement assigned to the property. Both techniques will filter the data according to the condition specified. The difference is that the Filter property is applied to a table that has already been loaded in memory, while the WHERE statement causes only the filtered records to be loaded from the database into memory.

When creating reports that include only small subsets large tables, the WHERE statement is a better option, because it doesn't require the entire table to be loaded into memory. On the other hand, if the table has already been loaded in memory, the Filter property is a better option, since it does not require any additional data to be loaded.

The syntax for the filter expression is the same used to specify the property for objects. The expressions consist of conditions in the form ColumnNameOperatorValue, where ColumnName is the name of a column in the data source (optionally enclosed in square brackets), Operator is one of the regular Visual Basic comparison operators, and Value is a literal enclosed in single quotes. Conditions may be concatenated using AND and OR operators.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.DataSource.MaxRecords
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of data rows to be included in the report (set to zero to include all rows).

remarks.para: This property is useful if you want to limit the size of a report. For example, you may write a report designer with a preview window that shows only the first 500 records from the database.
Setting this property to zero causes the control to retrieve all records.
You can also limit the size of reports by setting the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.DataSource.Recordset
member.summary: Sets or gets the data source object that provides data to the report.

remarks.para: Usually, the control creates a object based on the value of the and properties, and uses that object as the report data source.
Alternatively, you may want to create the data source object yourself, and assign it to the control. You can do that by assigning your data source object to the Recordset property.

When a DataTable or DataView object is assigned to the Recordset property, C1Report automatically creates an internal wrapper class that implements the interface. Because of this, you can't get the original DataTable or DataView objects back by reading the property value. Instead, you must cast the wrapper object to an and use the method instead, as shown in the example below.
remarks.value: You can assign objects of the following types to the property: (1) objects, (2) objects, or (3) any object that implements the interface.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.DataSource.CommandTimeOut
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of seconds to wait before the data connection times out (set to -1 to use the default value, usually 30s).

member.name: M:C1.C1Report.ExportFilter.IsPaged
member.summary: Determines whether this filter generates single or multi-page reports.

remarks.para: When generating paged reports, the component calls the filter's method on page breaks and updates the value of the property.
When generating non-paged (continuous) reports, only one long page is generated.

member.returns: True if report is paged.

member.name: M:C1.C1Report.ExportFilter.UsesImages
member.summary: Returns a value that determines whether the filter requires page images to be generated.

remarks.para: By default, will render the report into the filter and also into its own collection.

Some filters use these images to generate their output (e.g. PDF, TIFF). Other filters don't need the images (e.g. HTML, RTF) and therefore this method returns false, which saves some resources while rendering long reports.

member.returns: True if the filter requires page images.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.HtmlFilter.EncodeHtml
member.summary: Specifies whether field contents should be encoded or rendered in raw format. This property allows you to render fields that contain HTML formatting.

remarks.para: By default, field contents are encoded, so a field containing the string "A<B>C" would be rendered as "A<B>C", which would appear as the original string in the browser.
If you set to False, the same string would be rendered in raw format, causing the browser to display it as "A<B>C" (the "C" would be bold).

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.PdfFilter.EmbedFonts
member.summary: Specifies whether the filter should embed font information into the PDF output.

remarks.para: Embedding font information makes the PDF document substantially larger, but it allows the file to be viewed faithfully in systems that don't have all the necessary fonts installed.
Embedding fonts is not necessary if the target systems have the necessary TrueType fonts installed.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.PdfFilter.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the owner password associated with the PDF document.

remarks.para: The owner password is required for making changes to the document.
This property is deprecated. The new property allows you to set owner and user passwords, as well as permissions for editing and printing the document.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.PdfFilter.Outline
member.summary: Specifies whether the PDF output should include an outline tree.

remarks.para: The outline tree is created automatically based on the report groups and can be used to navigate through the report in the Adobe Acrobat viewer.
Each node in the tree corresponds to a group header section in the report. Invisible group header sections do not generate outline entries in the PDF document.

remarks.para: This filter is similar to the plain , except if generates RTF fields with absolute positioning. The resulting files are more accurate than the ones created with the plain RTF filter, but they are harder to edit and can only be opened in Microsoft Word (WordPad and other simple editors do not support RTF absolute positioning).

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.TiffFilter.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution of the TIFF document, in dots per inch.

remarks.para: The default value for this property is 300 DPI.
Setting the resolution to higher values result in documents with higher quality but significantly larger size, especially if the property is set to false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.TiffFilter.Monochrome
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the TIFF document should be saved in monochrome format.

remarks.para: The default value for this property is true, which results in much smaller documents that are compatible with fax machines (the compression used is CompressionCCITT4).
Set this property to false to generate color documents which use LZW compression but are substantially larger than monochrome documents (often 100 times larger using the same resolution).

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.SubreportHasData
member.summary: Returns whether a subreport has data and suppresses rendering if it doesn't.
member.remarks: This property allows you to check whether a subreport has data and prevent it from rendering if it doesn't.
member.example:
The code below uses script to hide sections with empty subreports:
_c1r.Sections.Detail.OnPrint = "Detail.Visible = fSubreport.SubreportHasData"
The code below uses script to hide a field containing an empty subreport and show another field instead:
_c1r.Sections.Detail.OnPrint = "hasData = fSubreport.SubreportHasData\r\n" + "fSubreport.Visible = hasData" + "fNoData.Visible = Not hasData\r\n" +

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the field name.

remarks.para: The field name can be used as an index into the control's collection.
Field names are also used to identify fields in VBScript expressions, as shown in the example below.
Duplicate and empty field names are allowed, but should be avoided if you plan to use the field names in scripts or as indexers.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Visible
member.summary: Specifies whether the will be rendered in the report.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets extra data needed by the calling program.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Index
member.summary: Returns the position of the field in the parent report's collection.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Section
member.summary: Gets or sets the section to which the field belongs.
member.remarks: To move a field from one section to another, set its property to a new value.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.ParentReport
member.summary: Gets the that contains this field.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.ParentSection
member.summary: Gets the that contains this field.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the field's text.

remarks.para: The property contains the text that will be rendered on the report.
This value may be rendered literally (without any translation) or it may be evaluated as a VBScript expression, depending on the setting of the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Calculated
member.summary: Specifies whether the property should be interpreted as a literal value or as a calculated expression.

remarks.para: If this property is set to false, the value of the property is rendered on the report without any further processing.
If it is set to true, the value of the property is evaluated as a VBScript expression and the result of the expression is rendered on the report.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the field's calculated value.

remarks.para: When a field's property is set to true, the control evaluates the expression stored in the property and stores the result in the property, which gets rendered into the report.
This is the field's default property, so when you use a field name in a VBScript expression, you are actually referring to the field's property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.HideDuplicates
member.summary: Specifies whether duplicate values in consecutive records should be suppressed.

remarks.para: You can use the property to hide a field on a report when its value is the same as in the preceding record.
For example, on a report listing suppliers and their products, each supplier's name can appear once for each group of products, rather than once for each product.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.RunningSum
member.summary: Specifies whether to show a running sum for the field.

remarks.para: You can use the property to calculate record-by-record or group-by-group totals in a report.
The property specifies whether a calculated field on a report displays a running total and lets you set the range over which values are accumulated.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Left
member.summary: Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the field's left edge in twips.

remarks.para: A field's location is the distance from its upper left corner to the upper left corner of its containing .
Setting the or property to zero places the field at the very left or top of its containing section.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the field's top edge in twips.

remarks.para: A field's location is the distance from its upper left corner to the upper left corner of its containing .

If the field's or properties are set to true, the control will automatically adjust the property to fit the field's contents and the property of fields below the current field to preserve the vertical distance between fields. The value of the and properties is not affected.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the field in twips.

remarks.para: Every object has a rectangle, or "field box", where the field contents are rendered.
The field box is defined by the , , , and properties.
These properties are expressed in twips, and the position is relative to the field's containing section.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the field in twips.

remarks.para: Every object has a rectangle, or "field box", where the field contents are rendered.
The field box is defined by the , , , and properties.
These properties are expressed in twips, and the position is relative to the field's containing section.
The field's property should be set to a value larger than or equal to the height of the field's , or no text will appear in the field.

If the field's or properties are set to true, the control will automatically adjust the property to fit the field's contents and the property of fields below the current field to preserve the vertical distance between fields. The value of the and properties is not affected.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.ForcePageBreak
member.summary: Specifies whether to insert page breaks before or after the field.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.CanGrow
member.summary: Specifies whether the field height should be automatically increased to fit the field's contents.

remarks.para: You can use the and properties to control the appearance of report fields and sections. When you set both properties to true, the field or section automatically adjusts so any amount of data can be printed. When a field grows or shrinks, the fields below it move down or up the page.

If you set a field's property to true, the control automatically sets the property of the containing section to true. (However, if you set a control's property to true, the control doesn't set the section's property to true.)
When you use the and properties, remember that:
1. The property settings don't affect the horizontal spacing between fields; they affect only the vertical space the fields occupy.

2. The height of a large field can prevent fields beside it from shrinking. For example, if several short controls are on the left side of a report's detail section and one tall control, such as an unbound object frame, is on the right side, the controls on the left won't shrink, even if they contain no data.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.CanShrink
member.summary: Specifies whether the field height should be automatically reduced to fit the field's contents.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.KeepTogether
member.summary: Specifies whether the field should be kept together on a page.

remarks.para: If this property is set to true, the control will insert page breaks in order to keep the field contents together on a page.
If it is set to false, and the containing also has its property set to false, then the field may be rendered across two or more pages.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Anchor
member.summary: Gets or sets the field's vertical position relative to its containing .

remarks.para: Normally, fields do not move when sections grow or shrink. In some cases, however, you may want fields to grow with the section or to stay in the same position relative to the bottom of the section.
This is especially common for fields used to create vertical lines that should extend the entire height of the section.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.ZOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets the ZOrder for the field.

remarks.para: The ZOrder of a field determines whether it is rendered in front of or behind other fields that overlap with it.
High ZOrder values bring the field to the front, low values send it to the back.
Because ZOrder values are relative, it is usually easier to call the method, which ensures the field is rendered in front of or behind all other overlapping fields.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.RenderTop
member.summary: Gets the y-coordinate of the field's top edge in twips after the and properties have been applied to the containing .
member.remarks: If the field's or properties are set to true, the control will automatically adjust the property to fit the field's contents and the property of fields below the current field to preserve the vertical distance between fields. The value of the and properties is not affected.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.RenderHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of the field in twips after the and properties have been applied to the field.
member.remarks: If the field's or properties are set to true, the control will automatically adjust the property to fit the field's contents and the property of fields below the current field to preserve the vertical distance between fields. The value of the and properties is not affected.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets a string used to format the field value.

remarks.para: You can use the property to customize the way numbers, dates, times, and text are displayed and printed.
For example, if you've created a Price field, you can set its property to "Currency". If the field value is set to "4321.678", it would be rendered as $4,321.68.
You can use the property to format numbers (including currency and percentage values), dates, boolean values, and strings.
The syntax for the format string is the same used with the .NET method.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.TextDirection

member.remarks: Not all output formats support vertical text. The preview, print, PDF, TIFF, and XLS formats do support vertical text. The HTML, RTF, and plain text formats do not.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.Picture
member.summary: Gets or sets a picture to display on the field.

remarks.para: You may set this property to three types of object:
1) Regular .NET objects.
2) Strings containing image file names or Urls.
3) Strings containing names of image fields in the report data source.
Options 1 and 2 are used to create unbound images, such as logos. These images do not depend on the report data.
Option 3 is used to create bound images, such as product or employee pictures. These are images stored with the report data.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.PictureAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets how field pictures should be the aligned.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.PictureScale
member.summary: Gets or sets how images should be the scaled to fit within the field area.

remarks.para: Depending on the setting of this property, images may be clipped, stretched, scaled (which preserves the image's aspect ratio), tiled, or hidden.
PictureScale works with the property so you can control image scaling and alignment independently.

member.name: P:C1.C1Report.Field.CheckBox
