member.name: T:C1.C1Rdl.Rdl2008.UserSort
member.summary: Represents properties of end-user sort control that is displayed as a part of a text box in the UI. The control allows the user to select a sort direction (ascending, descending, none).

member.name: M:C1.C1Rdl.Rdl2008.UserSort.AssignFrom(C1.C1Rdl.Rdl2008.UserSort)
member.summary: Copies properties from another to the current object.
member.param: The source object to copy properties from.

member.name: P:C1.C1Rdl.Rdl2008.UserSort.SortExpression
member.summary: Gets or sets the expression on which to sort. Has the same restrictions as a Group Filter expression. Aggregates used in SortExpression may only use scopes which equal or contain the . Aggregates without an explicit scope are not allowed in SortExpression if no is specified.

member.name: P:C1.C1Rdl.Rdl2008.UserSort.SortExpressionScope
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the scope (data region or group) in which to evaluate the . If omitted, the expression will be evaluated and the sort will be performed independently in each detail scope within the . Must be a scope that is equal to or contained within the current scope. If the has no current scope (in other words, it is not contained in any data region), SortExpressionScope must be equal to or contained within the . Cannot be a detail scope (that is, a group with no group expressions). The data set for SortExpressionScope must be the same as the data set for the . Sorting takes place within the group containing the SortExpressionScope. For example: In a with a country group and a city group with on each header and of the corresponding group, the country sort will sort the country groups within the tablix and the city sort will sort the city groups within each country group (without rearranging the country groups).

member.name: P:C1.C1Rdl.Rdl2008.UserSort.SortTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the data region, group or data set to apply the sort to. If omitted, the sort will apply to the instance of the current scope. Must be the current scope, an ancestor scope, or a peer scope which is a data region.

member.summary: Gets or sets value indicating whether the textbox height can decrease to match the contents.

member.name: P:C1.C1Rdl.Rdl2008.Textbox.HideDuplicates
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value controlling whether the text should not be displayed when the value of the expression associated with the report item is the same as the preceding visible instance.
The value of this property is the name of a containing group (other than the current group) or data set over which to apply the hiding. Each time a new instance of that group is encountered, the first visible instance of this report item will not be hidden. Rows on a previous page are ignored for the purposes of hiding duplicates.
If the current textbox is in a cell, only the text will be omitted. The text box will remain to provide background and border for the cell. Outside of a tablix cell, the background and borders are omitted as well. Ignored unless the text box contains only one .

member.name: P:C1.C1Rdl.Rdl2008.ParameterValue.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets possible value for the parameter. For Boolean parameters, use true and false. For DateTime parameters, use ISO 8601. For Float parameters, use . as the optional decimal separator. If the Value expression returns an array, each item in the array is treated as a single value. The items in the array must not be arrays.

member.name: P:C1.C1Rdl.Rdl2008.ParameterValue.Label
member.summary: Gets or sets label for the value to display in the UI. If not supplied, the is used as the label (if is not supplied, Label is the empty string). If the Value expression returns an array, the Label expression must return an array with the same number of items. If the Value expression does not return an array, the Label expression must not return an array.

member.summary: Gets or sets value indicating this is a multivalue parameter (a parameter that can take a set of values). Multivalue parameters are accessed in expressions as zero-based arrays in the Value and Label properties (for example, Parameters!Cities.Value(0) and Parameters!Cities.Label(0)). Ignored for Boolean parameters.

member.summary: Gets or sets the image source.

item.description: The property contains a constant or expression that evaluates to the location of the image. This can be a full folder path (for example, /images/logo.gif), relative path (for example, logo.gif) or URL (for example, http://reportserver/images/logo.gif). Relative paths start in the same folder as the report.
The property contains a constant or expression that evaluates to the name of an in the report.
The property contains an expression (a field in the database) that evaluates to the binary data for the image.

member.name: P:C1.C1Rdl.Rdl2008.Style.NumeralVariant
member.summary: Gets or sets the variant of the digit format to use. The valid values are from 1 (default) to 7. See remarks for details.

item.description: Default, follow Unicode context rules
traditional digits for the script as defined in GDI+. Currently supported for: ar | bn | bo | fa | gu | hi | kn | kok | lo | mr | ms | or | pa | sa | ta | te | th | ur and variants.
ko, ja, zh-CHS, zh-CHT only
ko, ja, zh-CHS, zh-CHT only
ko, ja, zh-CHS, zh-CHT only [Wide versions of regular digits]
ko only

member.name: P:C1.C1Rdl.Rdl2008.Visibility.ToggleItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the text box used to hide/unhide this report item. Clicking on an instance of the ToggleItem will toggle the hidden state of every corresponding instance of this item. If the ToggleItem becomes hidden (because either the item or an ancestor is toggled or conditionally hidden), this item should become hidden. Must be a text box in the same group scope as this item or in any containing (ancestor) group scope. If omitted, no item will toggle the hidden state of this item. Not allowed on and cannot refer to report items contained in a page header or footer. Cannot refer to a report item contained in the current report item unless current group scope has a Parent.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderBarCode.BarCodeType
member.summary:
Gets or sets the type of encoding to use when generating the barcode.
Note that BarCodeType.None is not a valid value for this property.
member.remarks: The selected encoding is applied to the value stored in the property to generate the barcode image displayed in the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderBarCode.ShowText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the string represending the property should be displayed along with the barcode image.
member.remarks: By default, the object will show only the barcode image. To include a textual representation of the value in the property, set this property to true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderBarCode.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that is encoded as the barcode image.

remarks.para: Some encodings support alphanumeric values of any length. Others are limited to numeric values or to a specific set of characters. See the enumeration for details.
If you use characters that are invalid for the current encoding, the object will display a blank image.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.AnchorEnum
member.summary: Determines how a is positioned with respect to its containing when the section grows or shrinks.
member.remarks: Use members of this enumeration to set the value of the property in the class.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.AnchorEnum.Top
member.summary: The field does not move. The space between the top of the field and the top of the section remains the same.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.AnchorEnum.Bottom
member.summary: The field moves vertically. The space between the bottom of the field and the bottom of the section remains the same.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.AnchorEnum.TopAndBottom
member.summary: The field grows or shrinks with the section. Both the distance from the top of the field to the top of the section, and the distance from the bottom of the field to the bottom of the section, remain the same.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.Original
member.summary: Gets the original object that produced the current object during data binding, or null if there is no such object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.TabPositions
member.summary: Gets the collection of objects describing text tab positions in the current object.
member.remarks: This property always returns a non-null collection, initializing it if it has not been initialized yet. Use to test whether there are any defined tab positions without initializing .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.HasTabPositions
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the collection has been initialized and contains at least one element.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text of the current object.

remarks.para: This property contains the text that will be rendered on the document.
Depending on the value of the property, this text may be rendered literally (as is, without any translation), or as a script expression.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.Picture
member.summary: Gets or sets a picture to display in the current field.

remarks.para: This property may be set to one of the following three kinds of objects:

list.item: A string containing an image file name or URL.
A string containing the name of an image field in the data source.

remarks.para: The first two options are used to create unbound images, such as logos. These images do not depend on the document data.
The third option is used to create bound images, such as product or employee pictures. These images are stored with the document data.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.DetectUrls
member.summary: If the current field's property is true, this property gets or sets a value indicating whether Uniform Resource Locators (URLs) will be automatically formatted when found in the text.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.Calculated
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the property should be interpreted as a literal value or as a calculated expression.

remarks.para: If this property is set to false, the value of the property is inserted in the document without any further processing.
If this property is set to true, the value of the property is evaluated as a script expression and the result of the expression is inserted in the document.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.HideDuplicates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether duplicate values in consecutive records should be suppressed.

remarks.para: You can use the property to hide a field in a document when its value is the same as in the preceding record.
For example, in a report listing suppliers and their products, each supplier's name can appear just once for each group of products, rather than repeat for each product.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets a string used to format the value of the current field.

remarks.para: You can use this property to customize the way numbers, dates, times, and text are displayed and printed.
For example, if you've created a Price field, you can set its property to "Currency". If the field value is set to "4321.678", it would be rendered as $4,321.68.
You can use this property to format numbers (including currency and percentage values), dates, boolean values, and strings.
The syntax for the format string is the same as used with the .NET method.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.LineSlant
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a line should be drawn across the current field.
member.remarks: The color, style, and thickness of the line are determined by the property.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.CheckBox
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current field should be displayed as a checkbox.
member.remarks: This property allows you to display boolean values graphically, rather than as plain text.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.RTF
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the content of the property on the current field should be interpreted as RTF.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.BarCodeType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of barcode displayed by the current field. The default value () indicates that the current field should not be rendered as a barcode.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.GeneralTextAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the text alignment in the current field should depend on the type of data represented by the field. If this property is true, numbers will align to the right while all other data to the left.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.HidePicture
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the image should not be displayed, works similar to .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.SubReport
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to a object to be rendered as a sub-report within the current field.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.CanGrow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the height of the current field can increase automatically to fit the field's content.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.CanShrink
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the height of the current field can decrease automatically to fit the field's content.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderField.Anchor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining the vertical position of the current field relative to the containing .

remarks.para: Normally, fields do not move when sections grow or shrink. In some cases, however, you may want fields to grow with the section or to stay in the same position relative to the bottom of the section.
This is especially common for fields used to create vertical lines that should extend the entire height of the section.

member.summary: IN: Right / Bottom border.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.SplitDimensionSize
member.summary: IN: Size of split dimension, on vertical split - height, on horizontal - width.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.NonSplitDimensionContentSize
member.summary: IN: The content size of non split dimension, on vertical split: Width - Inner.Left - Inner.Right; on horizontal split: Height - Inner.Top - Inner.Bottom.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.BordersSplitMode
member.summary: IN: RepeatBordersVert or RepeatBordersHorz.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.SplitVert
member.summary: IN: Indicates the type of split: vertical or horizontal.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.ChildrenAlwaysCanSplit
member.summary: IN: ChildrenAlwaysCanSplitVert or ChildrenAlwaysCanSplitHorz, depends on type of splitting: vertical or horizontal.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.SplitContext
member.summary: IN: Gets SplitContext object containing some global options for splitting.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.TopParentHardBreak
member.summary: IN: Indicates that the top parent object process the hard break.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.NewFragmentSize
member.summary: OUT (FindSplitPos): The size of new fragment, which is created at the split.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.ContentSplitOffset
member.summary: OUT (FindSplitPos): Offsets for split position within content area, the content area is split at position: RealSplitPos - ContentSplitOffset. ContentSplitOffset calculated on the base of padding / spacing / borders / RepeatBorders.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.ContentRealSplitPos
member.summary: OUT (FindSplitPos): The real split position within content area, calculated in the FindVertSplitPosContent / FindHorzSplitPosContent. ContentRealSplitPos = RealSplitPos - ContentSplitOffset. Also see comments to ReprintedFooterSize.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.ChildrenSplitPosOffset
member.summary: OUT (FindSplitPos): Offset of children' splitting position from ContentSplitPos.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.ReprintFooterSize
member.summary: OUT (FindSplitPos): The size of reprinted footer at the bottom of object, filled in the FindXXXContent method, after calling this method the ContentRealSplitPos does not include this size, and real RealSplitPos is: ContentRealSplitPos + ContentSplitOffset + ReprintFooterSize.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.ReprintHeaderSize
member.summary: OUT (FindSplitPos): The size of reprinted header at the top of object which was split.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.NeedReresolving
member.summary: OUT (Split): Indicates that after splitting the fragment which was split must be reresolved. This field filled after RenderFragment.Split method.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.SplitParams.AllChildrenSplitInSamePlace
member.summary: OUT: Indicates that all children splits at ONE line.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.GrowShrinkModeEnum
member.summary: Specifies the logic for handling the CanGrow and CanShrink properties of a C1Report's fields and sections in an imported report.
member.remarks: Use members of this enumeration to set the property in the class.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.GrowShrinkModeEnum.C1Report
member.summary: Uses the standard C1Report mode, where fields that grow or shrink affect only fields directly below.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.GrowShrinkModeEnum.Access
member.summary: Uses a mode that is similar to MS Access, where fields that grow or shrink affect all fields below, even if they are off to the side of the field that grew or shrank.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.RenderReport.GrowShrinkMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how and properties are handled.

remarks.para: If this property is set to , fields with or properties set to true will move fields directly below them when they grow or shrink. Fields located below but off to the side are not moved.

If this property is set to , fields that grow or shrink will affect all fields below, even those which are not directly under the field that was modified as a result of CanGrow/CanShrink. (This is the Microsoft Access behavior.)
For example, if fields are arranged in a grid layout and is set to , fields within each row will remain vertically aligned when fields above them grow or shrink.
If is set to , fields within each column will move independently of fields in other columns, and fields within each row will not remain vertically aligned.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateFuncEnum
member.summary: Defines the set of supported aggregate functions (see ).

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateFuncEnum.Sum
member.summary: Returns the sum of values of the expression within the scope.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateFuncEnum.Average
member.summary: Returns the average of values of the expression within the scope.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateFuncEnum.Count
member.summary: Returns the count of values of the expression within the scope.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateFuncEnum.Min
member.summary: Returns the minimum of values of the expression within the scope.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateFuncEnum.Max
member.summary: Returns the maximum of values of the expression within the scope.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateFuncEnum.CountDistinct
member.summary: Returns the count of distinct values of the expression within the scope.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateFuncEnum.First
member.summary: Returns the first (in the sorted sequence) value of the expression within the scope.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateFuncEnum.Last
member.summary: Returns the last (in the sorted sequence) value of the expression within the scope.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateFuncEnum.Var
member.summary: Returns the variance of values of the expression within the scope.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateFuncEnum.VarP
member.summary: Returns the population variance of values of the expression within the scope.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateFuncEnum.StDev
member.summary: Returns the standard deviation of values of the expression within the scope.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateFuncEnum.StDevP
member.summary: Returns the population standard deviation of values of the expression within the scope.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.RunningEnum
member.summary: Defines the scope of an .

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.RunningEnum.Document
member.summary: The scope is the whole document.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.RunningEnum.Group
member.summary: The scope is the current group as defined by .

member.summary: Represents an aggregate value calculated on a data-bound element of a over a certain scope.

assigned to the property of this aggregate.

member.summary: Assigns (copies) properties from another to the current object.

member.summary: Gets the containing the current aggregate.

member.summary: Gets or sets the function (min, max, average and so on) calculated by the current aggregate.
member.remarks: The default value of this property is .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.Aggregate.IgnoreNullValues
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether null values should be ignored when the current aggregate is calculated.
member.remarks: The default value of this property is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.Aggregate.Expression
member.summary: Gets the object used to calculate the value of the current aggregate.
member.remarks: Use the property to set the expression.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.Aggregate.ExpressionText
member.summary: Gets or sets the text of the object used to calculate the value of the current aggregate.
member.remarks: The property can be used to get the object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.Aggregate.DataBinding
member.summary: Gets or sets the data binding providing data over which the current aggregate is calculated.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.Aggregate.Running
member.summary: Gets or sets a value determining the scope of the current aggregate: whether it is calculated over all records, or separately for each group.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.Aggregate.Value
member.summary: Gets the value of the current aggregate, calculating it if it has not been calculated yet (the calculated value is cached).

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateCalculateModeEnum
member.summary: Specifies aggregates calculation mode.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateCalculateModeEnum.Simple
member.summary: Indicates that an aggregate should be calculated just over the specified datasource.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.AggregateCalculateModeEnum.Recursive
member.summary: Indicates that an aggregate should be calculated recursively, i.e. over all data in the current instance of the given scope, and over all descendant instances of the current instance.

member.summary: Tests whether the current data binding object is a parent (or a grand- or a deeper-level parent) of another object.
member.param: The object that is tested for being a child of the current object.

member.summary: Assigns (copies) properties from another to the current object.
member.param: The source object to copy properties from.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataBinding.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the current . That name can be used in aggregate functions to indicate which data binding the aggregate refers to.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataBinding.OutlineText
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string defining the used to generate the outline caption for objects produced by the current data binding.
For instance, if a render object is data bound to a data source that contains a field "CustomerName", setting this property to "Customer: [Fields!CustomerName.Value]" will generate an outline node similar to "Customer: John Doe" for each generated instance of the render object.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataBinding.ParentOutline
P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataBinding.Parent
member.summary: Gets the object which is the parent of the current data binding.
member.remarks: The parent is retrieved based on the objects' containment hierarchy. For instance, for a RenderText within a RenderArea, of the on the RenderText will return DataBinding of the RenderArea containing the text.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataBinding.Mode
member.summary: Gets the flags indicating the mode of the current data binding.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataBinding.Defined
member.summary: Gets a value indicating that the current data binding is not empty and is linked to some data.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataBinding.DataSource
member.summary:
Gets or sets the data source associated with the current data binding.
Currently objects of the following types can be assigned to this property:
If the data source is an , that expression must evaluate to an instance of a or a .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataBinding.Grouping
member.summary: Gets the object that determines how data retrieved by the current data binding is grouped.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataBinding.Sorting
member.summary: Gets the object that determines how data retrieved by the current data binding is sorted.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataBinding.Fields
member.summary: Gets the collection of data fields for the current data binding.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataBinding.Filters
member.summary: Gets the collection of expressions that are used to filter the data retrieved by the current data binding.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataBinding.Document
member.summary: Gets the object containing the current data binding.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataBinding.RowNumber
member.summary: Gets the current row or group instance number (see remarks).
member.remarks:
This property should only be used while the document containing the current data binding is generating. It then returns the number of the current data row.
When the document containing the current data binding is not generating, or if processing of the object on which the current data binding is defined has not started yet, this property returns 0.
When end of data has been reached during document generation, this property returnst the last row number.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataSchema
member.summary: Represents a data schema of a .
member.remarks:
This class contains:
The list of data sources associated with the document
The collection of data sources associated with the current document. Each element in that collection determines how to connect to an external data source (connection string etc.).
The collection of available data sets (tables, SQL queries).
The collection of aggregates defined on the data.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataSchema.Clear
member.summary: Clears the current data schema, deletes all associated data sets, data sources and aggregates.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataSchema.Owner
member.summary: Gets the containing the current data schema.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataSchema.DataSources
member.summary: Gets the collection of objects associated with the current data schema. Those data sources are used to provide data for elements of the collection.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataSchema.DataSets
member.summary:
Gets the collection of data sets provided by the current data schema.
A from this collection can be assigned to the property on of a , or on of a table row or column group ().

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.C1DataSchema.Aggregates
member.summary: Gets the collection of named objects defined on the current data schema.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.DataProviderEnum.OLEDB

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.DataProviderEnum.ODBC
member.summary: Microsoft Open Database Connectivity Driver.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.DataProviderEnum.XmlFile
member.summary: The XML file specified as the datasource, in this case the ConnectString contains name of file.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the data source. This determines the syntax of the ConnectionProperties.ConnectString and Query.CommandText.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.ConnectionProperties.ConnectString

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.DataSetField.Expression
member.summary:
Gets the used to calculate the value of the current field.
If this expression is not empty, the field is a calculated field (as opposed to a data field).

remarks.para: This property is never null (Nothing in VB), it always returns an object, which has empty by default. (A non-empty Text string indicates a calculated field.)
To specify an expression, set its property, or the property on the current field.
Either this property or , but not both, should be defined on a . In case both properties are defined, is used, and Expression is ignored.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.DataSetField.DataField
member.summary:
Gets or sets the name of the corresponding DB field in the query.
If this property is not empty, the field is a data field (as opposed to a calculated field).
member.remarks:
This name does not need to be unique within the containing collection, and multiple s may refer to the same DB field.
Either this property or , but not both, should be defined on a . In case both properties are defined, this property is used, and is ignored.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.DataBinding.DataSetField.ExpressionText
member.summary:
Gets or sets the text of the used to calculate the value of the current field.
This is a shortcut to the property on the expression returned by .

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintController
member.summary: The .NET PreviewPrintController creates metafiles with gdi+ commands. This is bad for us because the format of such emf records is not documented, and so we can not e.g. search for text. But, if we just use .NET PrintController, the page generation process slows down by a factor of 2 (at least). The only way to avoid this is to inherit from PreviewPrintController but provide our own graphics, based on emf-only metafiles. Another caveat is which base methods to call and which not. Invoking base.OnStartPrint/base.OnEndPrint is necessary because if we do not do that performance is the same as with the regular PrintController (i.e. bad). OTOH, invoking base.OnStartPage/ base.OnEndPage looks like wasting time (as we can not use the provided graphics anyway) and what is more, for big documents at some point seems to drain resources and causes our creation of metailes to fail. So what is below seems to be the only combination that works. Still, the whole printing stuff in .NET is a mess. --dima.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.RenderC1Printable
member.summary: Represents an external object that can be seamlessly rendered in a . See remarks for details.
member.remarks:
The object that this class renders is specified by the value of the property. For an object to be assignable to that property, it must expose either of the following two instance methods:
Image C1PrintableGetImage()If this method is implemented, it should return an representing the object to be rendered.
Stream C1PrintableGetTree()If this method is implemented, it should return a containing a serialized representing the object to be rendered. For instance, such stream can be created using the method.
To implement a C1PrintableGetTree() method on a class, follow these steps:
Add a method public Stream C1PrintableGetTree() to your class;
In that method's body, create a , and render a representation of your class into the of that document, using the available render objects such as , and so on.
At the end of that method, create a new object, call the method to save your document to that memory stream, and return it.
You will then be able to assign an instance of your class to the property of a object, and insert that object anywhere in a where a standard render object may occur.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.Scripting.ScriptingOptions
member.summary: Represents the various options controlling scripts and expressions used in a , and specified by the property.
member.remarks:
Scripts and expressions can be used in various contexts in a . While the scripting language and the set of available assemblies and namespaces for all those scripts and expressions are defined by the properties of the document's , the sets of built-in variable identifiers available to a script or expression depend on the context in which it is defined.
The following tables list the possible contexts, and the identifiers that can be used in scripts and expressions to access context-dependent document data:
Text expressions In expressions specified in square brackets in texts of , or objects, the following context-dependent identifiers can be used:
Id (type)Meaning
Document ()The current document.
RenderObject ()The current render object.
RenderFragment ()The current render fragment.
Page ()The current page.
PageNo ()The current 1-based page number.
PageCount ()The total page count.
PageX ()The current 1-based horizontal page number.
PageXCount ()The maximum horizontal page count.
PageY ()The current 1-based vertical (regular) page number.
PageYCount ()The total vertical page count.
Aggregates ()The list of aggregates defined on the current document.
DataBinding ()The active databinding (may differ from the value of the property on the current render object, e.g. if it is not defined and parent's databinding is being used).
Fields ()A shortcut to on the active databinding.
RowNumber ()A shortcut to on the active databinding.
(Note: while square brackets are the default for marking expressions in C1PrintDocument texts, they can be redefined via the and properties.).
expressions In expressions used in any of , , , , the following context-dependent identifiers are available:
Id (type)Meaning
Document ()The current document.
DataBinding ()The current databinding.
Fields ()The collection of the current databinding.
Parent ()The parent databinding. Normally this is the most nested databinding defined on a parent of the object containing the current databinding. For a , this may be the databinding defined on another row/column group if that group encloses the current group (i.e. contains all its rows/columns).
expression In expressions used to specify calculated data set fields (), the following context-dependent identifiers are available:
Id (type)Meaning
Document ()The current document.
Fields ()The collection of the current data set.
Document scope scripts In scripts assigned to , , or , the following context-dependent identifiers are available:
Id (type)Meaning
Document ()The current document.
Tags ()The collection of the current document (this is a shortcut to Document.Tags).
Render object scope scripts In scripts assigned to , the following context-dependent identifiers are available:
Id (type)Meaning
Document ()The current document.
RenderObject ()The current render object.
Tags ()The collection of the current document (this is a shortcut to Document.Tags).
Render fragment scope scripts In scripts assigned to , the following context-dependent identifiers are available:
Id (type)Meaning
Document ()The current document.
RenderObject ()The current render object.
RenderFragment ()The fragment that has resolved.
Tags ()The collection of the current document (this is a shortcut to Document.Tags).

member.summary: Fired from within the event handler of the current print manager, prior to actually printing the page. Allows to adjust the hard margins of the printer (e.g. to compensate for a buggy printer driver, see ), or to print the current page in user code (see ). See also .

member.summary: Describes arguments for the event, fired from within 's event handler. Allows the user to adjust hard printer margins (e.g. to compensate for a buggy printer driver), or to print the page in user code (in that case, should be set to true by the event handler).

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.AdjustPrintPageEventArgs.PrintableArea
member.summary: Gets or sets the physical printable area of the printer, in hundredths of an inch. When the event is fired, this property contains the printable area of the printer as returned by the printer driver, rotated if landscape printing. You may want to adjust this property e.g. to compensate for a buggy printer driver reporting incorrect hard margins.

member.summary: Occurs when a property on the current object changes.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintOptions.AutoPaperSource
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the paper source is selected automatically.
The default value is false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintOptions.PageScaling
member.summary:
Gets or sets the value indicating the manner in which pages are scaled during printing.
The default value is .

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintOptions.CenterPage
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the page should be centered on paper during printing.
The default value is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintOptions.AutoRotate
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether pages should be auto-rotated to better fit the paper during printing.
The default value is true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintOptions.PrintAsBitmap
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether page metafiles should be converted to bitmaps and clipped to printer's hard margins prior to printing.
The default value is false.
Normally document pages are sent to printer as metafiles. If a page exceeds the printable area of a printer, problems may occur with some printer drivers when the page is printed. In those cases set this property to true.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintOptions.DrawPrintableAreaBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a line is drawn around the printable area of the page. This may be useful for diagnostic purposes. is used to draw the line. The default is false.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintOptions.PrintableAreaBoundsPen
member.summary: Gets or sets the pen used to draw printable area bounds if is true. If this value is null (which is the default), a single-pixel black pen is used.

member.name: P:C1.C1Preview.C1PrintOptions.MsPrintDocumentPrintEmfType
member.summary:
Gets or sets the type of metafiles used when printing standard .NET PrintDocument documents.
The default is EmfType.EmfPlusDual.
If your printer needs to scan the output for data (e.g. a fax number; a case in point is Tobit Faxware) and fails, try setting this to EmfType.EmfOnly.
Note that this property ONLY affects printing of standard .NET PrintDocument documents, and has no bearing on other supported document types.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.RefreshModeEnum.NoRefresh
member.summary: Neither expressions nor data are refreshed. Note that if the document has not yet been generated, this mode is ignored (i.e. data is refreshed and expressions are calculated).

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.RefreshModeEnum.RefreshDataBinding
member.summary: Data is refreshed, all expressions are recalculated.

member.name: F:C1.C1Preview.RefreshModeEnum.RefreshCalculatedValues
member.summary: Expressions that do not reference data sources are recalculated, but data is not refreshed. Note that if the document has not yet been generated, this mode is ignored (i.e. data is refreshed).

member.summary:
Gets the object corresponding to the current page. After the current page has been resolved, this property allows to retrieve absolute values describing the geometry of the page, margins, and columns.
Note that if the current page has not been resolved yet, the value of this property is null, so you should always test it before accessing the nested properties.

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.RefDim
member.summary:
Internal, describes the dimensions of object.
Left, Top, Right, Bottom - Absolute coordinates on page.
RelLeft, RelTop, RelRight, RelBottom - Relative coordinates in parent.
ChildLeft, ChildTop, ChildRight, ChildBottom - Relative coordinates for child objects, ChildLeft and ChildTop are always 0, ChildRight = Width - SpacingLeft - SpacingRight - PaddingLeft - PaddingRight - BordersLeft - BordersRight
Width, Height - sizes of object.
ChildWidth, ChildHeight - sizes for child objects, for example, ChildWidth is Width - (SpacingLeft + BorderLeft + PaddingLeft) - (SpacingRight + BorderRight + PaddingRight).

member.name: T:C1.C1Preview.ZoomSliderScale
member.summary: A helper class that allows to use a slider control for a zoom factor value, placing zoom factor 1 (no zoom) in the middle of the slider control.
member.remarks: Consider a 2cm long slider used to set zoom values in the range from 0.1 to 10 (i.e. from 10% to 1000%). Using , the first centimeter of the slider will correspond to zoom values from 10% to 100%, and the second centimeter will correspond to zoom values from 100% to 1000%. On the other hand if a simple linear slider were used, all zoom values between 10% and 100% would have been squeezed into the first two millimeters of the slider, making it very hard to set those values.

member.name: M:C1.C1Preview.ZoomSliderScale.#ctor(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Minimum allowed zoom factor (must be less than 1; 1 means no zoom).
Maximum allowed zoom factor (must be greater than 1; 1 means no zoom).
Minimum possible slider value.
Maximum possible slider value.

member.summary: Converts a zoom factor to the corresponding slider value.
member.param: The zoom factor to convert (1 means no zoom).
member.returns: The slider value.

member.summary: Converts a slider value to the corresponding zoom factor.
member.param: The slider value to convert.
